page.title: 09Places of Worship
page.content: There are 2 Anglican churches in the area; the church in Shorwell is dedicated to St. Peter and dates from 1100 AD. It was originally a chapel for Northcourt manor and most of the building dates from the 15th century, with a great deal of 19th century restoration. There is a fine wall painting of St. Christopher dated 1440, the same date as the rare medieval pulpit. There are a large number of fine memorial brasses. There is a small Anglican church at Kingston; this and Shorwell share a vicar with Brighstone. There is also a small red brick Methodist chapel in Shorwell.
